greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: After a(0)=0, the first differences of A276573.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10028
Burkard Polster, Root 2 and the deadly Marching Squares, Mathologer video (2015)
formula: For all n >= 1, a(A260731(A132592(n))) = a(A260733(A001541(n))) = 2. [This is implied by the fact observed in the Polster video. Of course 2's occur at other points too.]
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 07 2016
